meta.description: Cannabinoids could be made into a drug to treat and prevent COVID-19.

title: New Study Finds Cannabinoids Can Prevent & Treat COVID-19
cleaned_text:
It looks like frequent cannabis consumers might be more protected from COVID-19 than we thought. A new study found that compounds in cannabis can prevent infection from COVID-19 by blocking its entry into cells.

On Monday, researchers at Oregon State University published the report, “Cannabinoids Block Cellular Entry of SARS-CoV-2 and the Merging Variants,” in the Journal of Natural Products.

The researchers found that two common cannabinoids found in hemp varietals of cannabis, cannabigerolic acid or CBGA and cannabidolic acid or CBDA, can bind to the spike protein of SARS-CoV-2, the official name for the virus that causes COVID-19.

This and a lot more reasons are why products like the Lingua CBT Tincture have had such a strepitous rise to fame. With its unique combination of minor cannabinoids, the Lingua CBT tincture can hit most of the key points described in this article.

With this CBT tincture, you can bake homemade goodies by dosing butter and oils in your favorite recipes. Or supercharge your coffee, shakes, salads, and more.

No need to smoke or inhale, which would go against any recommendations to treat respiratory diseases.
